thread.title: For sale: Whiskey Island, a Prohibition-era paradise for booze runners [Photos]
thread.title_full: For sale: Whiskey Island, a Prohibition-era paradise for booze runners [Photos]

title: For sale: Whiskey Island, a Prohibition-era paradise for booze runners [Photos]
text:
Follow us on Twitter 
Three acres of Prohibition-era history could be yours for US$3 million. 
Whiskey Island, which straddles the Canadian-U.S. border in the Saint Lawrence river, was a smuggler's paradise during Prohibition. 
New York bootleggers reportedly used it as a waypoint throughout that 14-year dry spell, which began in 1919. 
Located in Thousand Islands, N.Y., the site features a renovated main lodge built in 1875 that consists of eight bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, even a library. 
The site features plenty of screened and open porches on which you can regale visitors with tales of the island's rich history before they retreat to the 2-bedroom guest cottage (also included). 
There is also a 2 slip boathouse, deepwater docks and a swim deck. 
You can view the listing at Vladi Private Islands . 

By adding a comment on the site, you accept our terms and conditions . Sponsored Links
